images.image_description: Mata Krishna Devi, Mother of Satguru Swami Teoonram Ji Maharaj

text:
Our Poojya **Satguru Swami Teoonram Ji Maharaj** was born on Saturday **6th July, 1887** in a small village called **Khandu** on the banks of the holy river Sindhu in the province of Sindh; a pious land of Saints.

Swamiji's parents, **Mata Krishna Devi** and **Shri Chellaram Ji**, were great devotees of the Lord. They spent their lives in the service of the Saints.

images.image_description:
**Shri Shewakram Ji and Shrimati Ishwarbai Ji**
Father and Mother of Satguru Swami Sarvanand Ji Maharaj

text: **Satguru Swami Sarvanand Ji Maharaj** was born on a **Thursday**, in **October 1897**, near the river Sindhu in a village called **Bhitshah** at Bhakt **Shri Shewakram Ji** and **Shrimati Ishwarbai Ji's** house. Swami Ji was named **"Siru"**.

images.image_description: **Swami Teoonram Ji Maharaj, Swami Assuram Ji Maharaj** and **Swami Gwalanand Ji Maharaj** (Swami Ji's Younger Brother)

text: When Satguru Swami Teoonram Ji Maharaj was around 13-14 years old, **Swami Assuram Ji Maharaj** came to Khandu village. One day while conducting a discourse at the house of Bhakt Chellaram, Swami Assuram Ji explained the **grandness of a Guru**. He mentioned that it is essential to get initiated and follow a Guru; he explained that without a Guru it is not possible to attain self-realization in this human life. The following day Satguru Swami Teoonram Ji Maharaj took **mantra diksha** from Satguru Swami Assuram Ji Maharaj and made him his **Guru**.

When **Swami Sarvanand Ji Maharaj** was nine years old, he requested Poojya **Swami Teoonram Ji Maharaj** to accept him as a disciple and grant him the **sacred name**. It took **nine years** of service, devotion, and perseverance after which Swami Ji was granted the sacred name. Satguru Swami Teoonram kept his name as **"Sarvanand"**. Swami Ji wholeheartedly served his Guru Swami Teoonramji Maharaj.

Since he highly revered **Mata Ganga**, he used to often take permission of his Gurudev to go to meditate in the holy land of **Haridwar** and in the dense forests of **Rishikesh**.

**Satguru Swami Teoonram Ji Maharaj's** great disciple karam yogi **Satguru Swami Shantiprakash Ji Maharaj** came to this earth in the month of Saawan in the year 1907 on **Nariyal Poornima** (Shri Satyanarayan - Full Moon Day) on the occassion of the pious festival of Raksha Bandhan day. He was born in the Province of Sindh in the **Sakkhar** district in a village known as **"Chak"**. His father whose name was **Shri Assoodhomal** and mother **Shrimati Jugadevi** both were devoted pious souls and religiously served many saints and seers. This caused great impact on the life of Swami Shanti Prakash Ji Maharaj. Satguru's birth name was **Khairaj**.

After some time Maharaj Shree started academic education when suddenly he developed measles and starting losing his eyesight.

His father took him to a great Saint of Sind, **Sant Harchooram** who blessed the child and asked the father not to worry. His child would not be at loss even after losing his eye sight, on the contrary, he would enlighten the world with his inner light. A sage would visit Chak and would take him with himself.

images.image_description: **Shri Amrapur Darbar, Prem Prakash Ashram, Tando Adam, Sindh**
**Shri Amrapur Darbar, Prem Prakash Ashram, Tando Adam, Sindh**

**Shri Amrapur Darbar, Prem Prakash Ashram, Tando Adam, Sindh**

text:
Satguru Swami Teoonram Ji Maharaj spent his entire life in the service of mankind and spreading the teachings of **"Sanatan Dharma"** to each and every corner of Sindh, illumining thus the entire Sindhi culture.

In 1920, while travelling with his disciples, Satguru Ji reached the vast sandy expanse of **Tando Adam**, which had a dense jungle on its other side. Satguru Ji decided that this place would be appropriate for establishing a centre for the dissemination of Sanatan Dharma.

Satguruji along with the Sages and devotees worked day and night to build a platform to conduct the discourses and **"Amrapur Asthaan"** was built.

Swami Ji formed the **Prem Prakash Mandal** with the principles of spreading of the vedic culture, awakening and sowing the seeds of devotion towards God in the people's mind, service to mankind irrespective of caste and creed, maintenance of religious unity and that of harmonious relations with every other religious sect.

In 1923, at the age of 16, **Swami Shantiprakash Ji Maharaj** met his Spiritual Master, Braham Gyani **Satguru Swami Teoonram Ji Maharaj**, the pioneer of Prem Prakash Mandal. Accepting Swami Ji under his fold, Satguru Swami Teoonram Ji Maharaj brought him to **Amrapur Asthaan** in **Tando Adam, Sindh** and began to build up his spiritual life by doing sheva.

In 1930, in the village of **Hindan**, district **Samghar** Sindh, **Satguru Swami Haridasram Ji Maharaj** was born, in the house of pious souls, **Shri Hiranand** and **Mata Moeta Bai**. Mata Moeta Bai was the **sister** of **Satguru Swami Sarvanand Ji Maharaj**.Poojya Satguru Swami Haridasram Ji Maharaj was given the name **"Lalchand"**.

Eversince childhood, Swami Ji was in the company of both Satguru Swami Teoonram ji Maharaj and Satguru Swami Sarvanand ji Maharaj.

Poojya **Satguru Swami Teoonram Ji Maharaj** left for His **heavenly abode** in **May 1942** on a **Saturday** in Tando Adam (Sindh) at **Prem Prakash Ashram**.

The day was Saturday and tithi Chhouth. Swamiji's Birth Day was Saturday and the day He left for Amarlok was also Saturday. The Birth Date was Chhouth and the date He left for Amarlok was also Chhouth.

Upon hearing this news, many of his devotees came from all over Sindh and paid their respects. With the **holy ashes** of Swami Teoonram Ji Maharaj, a beautiful **Samadhi** was constructed in **Tando Adam**.

**Swami Sarvanand Ji Maharaj** dedicated his entire life to his Guru. When Satguru Swami Teoonramji Maharaj left for heavenly abode, Swami Sarvanand was enthroned as the **Gadeshwar** (spiritual head) of **Prem Prakash Mandal**. Swami Sarvanand followed the same principles of his Guru and spent his entire life spreading the teachings of Satguru Swami Teoonram Maharaj. He spread the fragrance of the **"Satnam Sakhi"** mantra across the world. He emphasized on the importance of the auspicious day, Saturday, to all Prem Prakashis.

After India gained its Independence, **Satguru Swami Sarvanand Ji Maharaj** came to India and worked very hard to build **Amrapur Darbar** in **Jaipur** in the likeness of the temple in Tando Adam, Sindh. Swami Ji put immense efforts and compiled the teachings of our **Acharya Satguru Swami Teoonramji Maharaj** in a large Granth of about **800 pages** of Sindhi and Hindi verses, known as the **"Shri Prem Prakash Granth"**.

He inaugurated the new Amrapur Darbaar by celebrating the **Chaitra Mala** (every year we celebrate this mela to conmemorate the occasion).

In the years 1974 and 1975, **Satguru Swami Sarvanand Ji Maharaj** traveled to several **countries around the world**. Throughout these international tours, as well as during many of their travels within India, he was accompanied by **Satguru Swami Haridasram Ji Maharaj**.

On **21 July, 1977** Poojya **Satguru Swami Sarvanand Ji Maharaj** left us for his **heavenly abode** and according to his wish his ashes were taken to **Haridwar** and scattered in the waters of the **Holy Ganga**.

**Satguru Swami Shanti Prakash Ji Maharaj** succeeded him on **4 August, 1977** and he humbly said:
"You all have entrusted me with great responsibility. I am a most humble servant of Guru Maharaj. I am nothing. I am Zero. All are his manifestation, He is the Supreme Director. We all are his artists and I will carry on this holy mission under the kind guidance of Satguru Swami Teoonram Ji Maharaj and Satguru Swami Sarvanand ji Maharaj."

On **15 August, 1992**, Poojya **Satguru Swami Shanti Prakash Ji** left for the **heavenly abode**.

**Satguru Swami Haridasram Ji Maharaj**, was then named **"Gadeshwar"** of the Prem Prakash Mandal on **30 August, 1992**.

On **26 August, 2000** Poojya **Satguru Swami Haridasram Ji Maharaj** departed for the **heavenly abode**, leaving behind a legacy of divine love and spiritual guidance.

Today, **Satguru Swami Bhagat Prakash Ji Maharaj** leads as the revered **Gadeshwar** of the Prem Prakash Mandal, continuing to bless all premis with the boundless love and devotion that fills our hearts in the sacred service of Satguru Maharaj.
